column4: anyone has any idea on installing ubuntu on free space on a sata disk (without losing all data)?
I have but it doesn't show me any existing partitions
bit: I see the drive... just that there are no partitions on it
I have it formatted an windows running on ntfs partition I also have free space for linux partition... but the installer doesn't recognize the partitions
well AFAIK it is not in raid but the motherboard does have raid support
Did you choose 'dynamic partitions' in Win?
not that I know... what's that?
the screwd up Win-version of lvm... if you have this dynamic partition thingy enabled, there's no readable partition table on the drive... win does it's own thing and hides everything
how do I check to see if I have one?
you have to be in Win(XP|2000) and look in the disk-administration control-applet. (Where the drive letters ...brrr.... are defined)
I'm in... now where do I check for dynamic partitions? do you know or should I just look until I find it
Please do not ask me to explain windows... somewhere in the admin-tools section there's a disk and partition info utility... cal Bill Gates for support
I can't find that dynamic yadayada..... but It is funny becouse if I boot with Mandriva disks I see the partitions....
ok, then ... it's not enabled, because if mandriva can see it, ubuntu will too, sooner or later
what is not enabled?
dynamic disks in windows is obviously not enabled. Do you have a Linux Live-CD you can boot? the output of 'fdisk -l' would be interesting
i have liveCD
the fdisk -l does not say any thing
did u 'sudo fdisk -l' ?
I did it as root
hmm, and 'cat /proc/partitions' gives waht?
